par.text: Zirconium is a silvery-grey, shiny metal. It is resistant to atmospheric exposure, acids and alkalis and amongst acids reacts only with hydrogen fluoride - HF. When heated, zirconium reacts with oxygen, sulphur, carbon and nitrogen. The name of the element is derived from the name of the mineral zircon, in which zirconium is found.
